availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Bell (Washington County, Kentucky, farmer, carpenter, and soldier)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, farmer, carpenter, and soldier. Son of Phoebe Bell. Married to Anne M. Scott Bell in Washington County, Kentucky, on February 11, 1853. Father of Bettie T. Bell, William C. Bell, Mary G. Bell, Edwin M. Bell, and John Bell. Farmer in Anderson County in 1850. Carpenter in Washington County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Calvary Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant and captain from September 22, 1862 to July 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 212B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, Springfield, p. 226.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, North, p. 347A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994057, Washington County Marriages.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 282.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0105
"William Henry "W. H." Bell," (1828-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial 119024937, accessed May 22, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/119024937.
